result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin L. Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
No contact J.K. or residences or her family members.

Participate and engage in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
Early discharge after 18 months, if successfully completes and Agent recommends.
Comply with same conditions as Count 1 and same early discharge condition.

records.addlTxt: of Plea & Sentencing on 10-18-2016

9:07 a.m. Defendant Quentin L. Coleman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Victims notification was complied with and she is not present.
ADA Knaapen informs the Court of the Victims requests for sentencing.
Defendant enters a plea of: 
Amended Count 1: Guilty
Added Count 2: Guilty
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 & Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
ADA Knaapen further explains the reasons for the amendment and recommendation. 
Atty Renc concurs with joint agreement and further explains the reasons for the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION***
Count 1:
I/S Sentence:
9 months Jail - stayed
24 mo Probation
Conditions:
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  
Participate and engage in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
Pay costs & DNA surcharges.
No contact J.K. or residences or her family members.
Pay $45 crime victim compensation.
Early discharge after 18 months, if successfully completes and Agent recommends.

Count 2:
I/S Sentence:
9 months Jail, consecutive - stayed
24 mo Probation, concurrent with Count 1.
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as Count 1 and same early discarge condition.
Pay costs & DNA surcharges.

Parties and victime do not request Defendant to register for sex offender.
BTC: Court does not require the Defendant to register.

ADDRESS INFO for Quentin L. Coleman
Current: 301 Michigan Ave #325-2, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-28-2016)
Prior: 2640 Bush Court, Apt. 11, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Quentin L. Coleman in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF88 and 16CF75.

10:08 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court has received Atty Renc's Jury Instructions and Motions in Limine; State has received both documents.
Court questions what needs to be done on the record; Atty Knaapen makes statements on the record.
Atty Knaapen has one concern regarding a witness (A.B.) and states his concerns on the record.
Atty Renc agree's with Atty Knaapens concerns and makes her statement on the record.
Court makes statements on the record regarding the jury instructions; Court is not comfortable amending the standard jury instructions.
Atty Renc makes statements on the record; Atty Renc will provide the Court and State with a copy of the footnote she is referrring to on her
jury instructions.
Atty Knaapen makes statements regarding the current issue at hand - footnote on jury instruction.
Court makes further statements on the record.
Atty Knaapen states that the parties are still in negotiations to see if this case can be resolved prior to the Jury Trial set for 09/21-22/16.
Court makes additional statements.
Atty Knaapen makes statements that Court will need to be informed at least by noon the day prior to the Jury Trial if they have resolved this case.

BY THE COURT:
Motions in Limine for Defense is GRANTED.
Atty Renc to provide jury instruction to Court and the State and highlight the footnote.
filed by the defense
requested by the defense
original filed in 16CF75
Jury trial - 12 person on September 21, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Renc & response note from Judge
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on June 6, 2016 at 10:45 am.
from ADA Knaapen
Motion hearing on June 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:32 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a hearing on a previous motion.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, there was a hearing, then an outstanding report the Court gave 20 days the State to turn over or provide why they did not do so.

Court received the State's letter and a copy was sent to Atty Renc, that was the last activity on the file.

Atty Renc submitted a proposed order March 11th and the March 22nd letter is the last communication in the file.

Atty Renc is requesting the nurse practiction's testimony be precluded.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, reiterates what is in the letter, the date was the hangup. Hospital had treatment be provided Feb 8th but Officer's report had Feb 9th. State finally received the information and was given to Atty Renc.  State was being told continually there were no records but then found the discrepency and received the records. 

Atty Renc replies, acknowledges receiving the examination on April 11th.  Requests the Court to sign the proposed order for sanctions.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the saction requested. Court denies the application for the sanction.

(9:38 AM Defendant now appears).

Atty Renc states this has not jeopardized the date for the jury trial.

Trial remains scheduled and will probably go.

State requests a hearing to discuss any motions in limine.
Atty Renc concurs.

  Motion hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty Renc - request for sanctions

letter from Atty Anne Renc to Honorable Judge Shannon dated 03/11/16 in re:  failed to receive the SANE examination requested from the State within 20 days; Order of the Court attached with a partial transcript
Hearing on April 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial at 06-22-2016 08:30 am
Jury trial at 06-22-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Quentin L. Coleman in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for a Motion Hearing filed by the defense in re:  Sanctions.

2:53 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court questions Atty Renc if she has had the opportunity to speak with Atty Knaapen regarding the Discovery issues; Atty Renc responds.
Atty Renc indicates that she has not received recordings/reports from the sane examination.
Atty Knaapen makes statements regarding this issue.
Atty Renc responds to the statement of Atty Knaapen.
Atty Knaapen again responds and makes a statement.
Court questions what the recording is in regards to; Atty Renc responds.
Court questions Atty Renc if she is satisfied with Atty Knaapen's representation that the release is being obtained from the victim and that the information requested will then be turned over to Atty Renc.  Atty Renc is satisfied but would like to have had in a more timely manner.  Atty Renc makes additional statements.  
Atty Renc indicates that the State is requesting an adjournment of the Jury Trial and is in agreement with this adjournment.
Court makes additional statements regarding the sane report and it being turned over to Atty Renc.
Atty Renc does not object to a continuance of the Jury Trial.

BY THE COURT: 
Sane report to be provided to the defense within 20 days; and if not then court would grant that part of the defenses motion.
Any records regarding the sane examination be provided to the defense within the 20 days from today's date unless there is good reason that it is not available.
Jury Trial to be re-scheduled to June 22-23, 2016.
  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
